I've followed the game since its inception back in 2016, and I finally got it this year. Having played it myself for what is now close to a thousand hours and become pretty darn good at playing the Killer (we don't need to talk about my Survivor gameplay, but I've played a lot of Survivor as well), I can say that, honestly? I love this game to death. HOWEVER ... I say that with some reservations.

There are quite a few pros: yes, the game is a solid and fun concept, which you won't see much of elsewhere to any great quality; while the horror aspect wears off for most people after the first couple hours, the strategy and intense, competitive gameplay quickly take over as the game's main draw. Randomized matches (a blessing and a curse) keep things at least somewhat fresh almost every match, and there are some INCREDIBLY satisfying moments you can pull off. Some people might care about getting to play their favorite slashers; I'm more in it for the gameplay itself, but that's definitely a draw.

But for all that, the game really does have some SERIOUS flaws.

Thing one: the community can be very entitled. Once you get past casual players, a lot of people are out to make sure no one else has a fun experience except for them, and that's ... well. Not fun. I don't mind it that much (mainly by virtue of not caring), but it's not fun for newer players being borderline bullied with game mechanics all match, nor is it any more fun to receive a tirade about why you ruined someone else's fun by not playing according to their rules (deserved or otherwise).

Thing two: People like to win, and the game isn't exactly what one could call balanced (balancing asymmetrical things is hard), which means there are plenty of imbalanced things to exploit. The developers can sometimes feel very out of touch with the community, and the community itself can be very clueless about what the right choices are even when the developers DO listen (can we NOT have more breakable walls, please? and for Christ's sake, stop complaining/cheering about new Object, people, it's really not that big a deal). This leads to very one-sided or boring maps like Gideon Meat Plant or the notorious Haddonfield, perks that can seem very unfair from time to time (even when they're not), and any number of situations where losing just doesn't feel like your fault, or where you feel as if you're forced to play in a not-fun way.

Thing three: bugs. The game is QUITE buggy, and not exactly what I'd call "well-optimized." New players beware, there's an autoaim/aim-dressing mechanic that can be used to spin you into missing an attack very easily by experienced players or even just arbitrarily by the game. And that's just scratching the surface; there are many, MANY new bugs practically every patch. Most of the time they aren't too much issue, but don't be surprised if things blow up in your face once in a while.

Thing four: probably the biggest danger. The game is INCREDIBLY addictive, in addition to being a massive grind. I have almost a thousand hours in the game, and I don't have more than about half the DLCs, and I still am not really anywhere even close to having everything unlocked. Dead by Daylight can very quickly suck all fun out of its own experience if you're playing it just for the sake of playing it, so you have to take it somewhat in moderation.

With all of that said, this game comes down to a trade-off. If you're okay dealing with some questionable balance/functionality from time to time, if you feel like you don't have any issues with an at times very entitled community (although for the most part it's actually remarkably non-toxic, counter to its reputation), if you just want to chill and play a fun asymmetrical game to either murder people or escape being murdered, then this is top-of-the-line, no matter the issues. Play the way you want to, and don't care too much about the result, and it'll stay fun for sure.

If you're iffy on some of those issues, though, I wouldn't really recommend the game unless you're consistently going to have 3 or 4 friends to play either in a full SWF (survive-with-friends) group or in custom games with.

I've been a player of this game since 2018 and have had an enjoyable experience playing it, but with recent updates and new added killers such as the trickster that feel out of place the experience just get worse. There are significant flaws in the game that have not been patched or fixed. No, Instead the developers implement a battle pass system and more micro transactions that brings more money to the developers pockets yet none of this is used to actually fix the game. 

The devs find several ways to nerf the killers that makes the game such a boring disaster for killer mains. Good luck attempting to win against gen rushing survivor squads. Before you know it the survivors will have fixed all gens and you will get queued up for the same experience next game. For killers ebony Mori's are nerfed which are one of the rarest items to acquire yet survivor keys that let them leave the game prematurely are still just as OP. It's so one sided it's not even fun. 

It's not even fun for survivors either, everyone is playing on the same meta. There's a bunch of perks yet half of them are so useless unless you're just in it to throw the game/troll. Look forward to equipping the same stale loadouts for both killer and survivor for your games if you actually want to win and I applaud you if you don't get bored by it.

Oh, and I was talking about micro transactions wasn't I? It would have been fine if it was solely aesthetic but this game is actually P2W. Certain killers and survivors have good perks that can only be acquired if it appears in the Shrine of secrets or if you actually buy the killer/survivor to get the perk. If you want to go the shrine of secrets route you have to wait weekly and there is no guarantee it will appear there either. It's 2021 and yet games are still relying on scummy P2W mechanics just to get a few extra bucks. 

If Dead by Daylight had any sort of competition then I'm sure they'd actually start taking the game's health seriously, but for now they don't care, and they haven't cared for the past 4 years. But for sure when there is a game similar to DBD made by a different company I'm dropping this game. And I would not recommend anyone else to get into this game unless you're looking forward to a ride of patch notes that will leave you scratching your head by developers who don't even understand what they are doing.
